intro: Lamprocarpus thyrsiflorus, commonly known as the mountain fennel, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, cool environments such as forest margins and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive, often spicy scent when crushed. The flowers, which are small and white to pale yellow, appear in dense, branched clusters and attract various pollinators.
